‚ûïExtensions#

‚≠ê How to create an Extension:#

In goldy bot instead of cogs or whatever you may call them we have extensions.

Extensions are‚Ä¶. well‚Ä¶. EXTENSIONS! They are modules that extend the goldy bot framework. You can create an extension for ANYTHING, a music bot, commands to lookup game stats and a lot more exciting commands. ‚òÅ The skies your limit.

Here are quick examples to get started with extensions in Goldy Bot V5. üåü

This is GoldyBot v5 extension done natively within python. üòä

import GoldyBot

class YourExtension(GoldyBot.Extension):
   def __init__(self):
      super().__init__()

   @GoldyBot.command()
   async def hello(self, platter: GoldyBot.GoldenPlatter):
      await platter.send_message("üëãhello", reply=True)

def load():
   YourExtension()

This is a GoldyBot v5 extension done within javascript using our GBExtension.js API that‚Äôs going to be coming soon. üòä

class YourExtension extends GoldyBot.Extension {
   constructor() {
      super();
   }

   async hello(platter) {
      await platter.send_message("üëãhello", {
         "reply": true
      });
   }
}

function load() {
   new YourExtension();
}

Neat right üòÅ.

Note

The javacript api is not written yet so the code in this example is subject to massively change. This is only a mockup.

Extensions#

class GoldyBot.goldy.extensions.Extension[source]#

Bases: object

The base class for a Goldy Bot extension.

‚≠ê Example:#

This is how you set up an extension in a GoldyBot module:

class YourExtension(GoldyBot.Extension):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()

    @GoldyBot.command()
    async def hello(self, platter: GoldyBot.GoldenPlatter):
        await platter.send_message("üëãhello", reply=True)

def load():
    YourExtension()

More at our docs.

property code_name: str#
property loaded_path: str#

The path where this extension was loaded.

async unload() → None[source]#

Unloads and deletes itself from cache and all the commands with it.

GoldyBot.goldy.extensions.extensions_cache: List[Tuple[str, object]] = []#

This cache contains all the extensions that have been loaded and it‚Äôs memory location to the class.

Extension Loader#

class GoldyBot.goldy.extensions.extension_loader.ExtensionLoader(goldy: Goldy, raise_on_load_error: bool | None = True)[source]#

Bases: object

Class that handles extension loading.

load() → None[source]#
load(extension_paths: List[str]) → None

Loads each extension in this list of paths. If extension_paths is kept none, goldy bot will search for extensions to load itself.

Extension Reloader#

class GoldyBot.goldy.extensions.extension_reloader.ExtensionReloader(goldy: Goldy)[source]#

Bases: object

Class that handles extension reloading.

async reload() → None[source]#
async reload(extensions: List[Extension]) → None

Reloads each extension in this list. If extensions is kept none, goldy bot will reload all the extensions loaded itself.
